title: Use uploaded logo.svg in header with primary brand color

requirements.text: Update the site header to use the uploaded `logo.svg` asset and ensure it renders in the primary brand color (#2E0527) on both desktop and mobile. The logo must render as an actual image/graphic (not alt text) and should not rely on inline `style={{ color: ... }}` on an `` tag (since that does not theme most SVG images). Ensure the logo source path is consistent across the codebase (e.g., avoid mixing `/assets/logo.svg` and `/assets/images/logo.svg`) and that the rendered logo color follows `text-primary` / `currentColor` so it stays aligned with the theme.

quotes:
changes
- use the uploaded logo.svg file with the primary color

acceptanceCriteria: On all breakpoints, the header logo renders visually (no alt-text-only rendering) and links to `/`.
The header logo color is exactly the primary brand color (#2E0527) in normal/light mode.
The solution uses a themeable approach (e.g., `currentColor` / `text-primary` or equivalent) rather than an inline `color` style on an `` element.
Only one canonical logo asset path is used by the header logo implementation, and it resolves without 404s in the deployed build.

constraints: Do not modify any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (shadcn UI sources are read-only).
Do not modify any files listed in `frontend.immutablePaths` from SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor; no backend changes are needed for this request.
nonGoals: No homepage/hero/layout redesign changes beyond what is necessary to update the header logo.
No changes to clinic content, SEO, services, reviews, or booking links as part of this request.
